column4: Why is 43megs of my swap memory being used if i have 70% of my RAM free?
pawalls, then from terminal: unrar <file> or right click - extract from GUI
if I understand the use of swap correctly. files are placed there for faster access
isn't swap done on the hard drive rather than RAM? wouldn't that be slower?
well to a certain extent yeah it might be a little slower then putting them on ram but if everything gets sent to ram for faster access you would soon run out of ram
that lists your hardware by name how much more human-readable do you wantr
thee is a GUI not sure what it is called. check in System>Admin>    see what is in there
I might be wrong. I don't see anything like you are looking for
It's not perfect, but gnome-device-manage ris nice :) thanks
or you installed some kde app and it brought in a ton of kde stuff with it
That would be likely. i use k3b
